name: Islamic Society of Greater Houston
mission: Helping the community to live sustainable lives.
zakatClaimEvidence: As part of its zakat services, the ISGH has special food stamps which can be used to pay bills and rent, bus fare, and items from Muslim grocery stores. They have a system in place to receive their zaka. money and an online system to pay it. In 2024, ISGH was among the largest providers of financial assistance in our community with over $4.9M in Zakat and Sadaqah distributions. The ISGH website also lists 'ISGH Zakat Ul Maal' under 'Online Giving' and provides an 'ISGH Assistance Application' with an email address 'zakat@isgh.org' for submitting zakat requests. (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGLB5ffemMFN7ZaGRUjlLW6W1yEfMuBTmXW83DPQsp1hQ-J_gttvRvmWpfnHlXbc-W2BP1AG-9NV43fu1ZnN52nwXw_nKnoF_JPgrI8awMKZtkE_BYV4ZvHTR_ujnGLF4Zrrf6DcZMo2T1AExcswvaV8aRyJLgtth_laDk=)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Limited match due to weaker results and/or higher uncertainty; review methodology details before deciding.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5)
components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or program and highlight humanitarian dimensions of your work
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.evidence: Niche cause: RELIGIOUS_CULTURAL (+4); Serves underserved populations (+3)
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 30/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish operating-reserve levels and adopt a board-approved reserve policy (typically 3-12 months for most nonprofits).
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes for 3+ years
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

components.evidence: Theory of change: BASIC (emerging org baseline)
components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with causal pathway
components.name: Theory of Change

components.evidence: Board governance: baseline (2 members, emerging org)
components.name: Governance

risks.risk_summary: Key concern: Board too small: 2 members

score_details.score_summary: Islamic Society of Greater Houston shows good alignment and limited impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: As part of its zakat services, the ISGH has special food stamps which can be used to pay bills and rent, bus fare, and items from Muslim grocery stores. They have a system in place to receive their zaka. money and an online system to pay it. In 2024, ISGH was among the largest providers of financial assistance in our community with over $4.9M in Zakat and Sadaqah distributions. The ISGH website also lists 'ISGH Zakat Ul Maal' under 'Online Giving' and provides an 'ISGH Assistance Application' with an email address 'zakat@isgh.org' for submitting zakat requests. (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGLB5ffemMFN7ZaGRUjlLW6W1yEfMuBTmXW83DPQsp1hQ-J_gttvRvmWpfnHlXbc-W2BP1AG-9NV43fu1ZnN52nwXw_nKnoF_JPgrI8awMKZtkE_BYV4ZvHTR_ujnGLF4Zrrf6DcZMo2T1AExcswvaV8aRyJLgtth_laDk=)

all_citations.claim: The organization manages weekend school enrollment, Quran distribution, and total assistance distributed to the community.
The organization is zakat-eligible and provides various giving methods for community members.
The organization is registered under EIN 23-7065716 and maintains a profile for financial metadata.
Financial data including revenue, expenses, and assets are reported via IRS filings.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization receives a moderate overall score of 40/100, reflecting its significant community presence balanced against a lack of transparent financial reporting and low data confidence.
areas_for_improvement: Limited transparency regarding standardized financial efficiency metrics and third-party ratings
Low data confidence due to missing granular financial performance indicators

dimension_explanations.alignment: The alignment score of 30/50 is medium, reflecting a strong fit for Muslim donors due to its zakat-eligible status and focus on religious cultural urgency, though its track record is primarily documented through internal reports [1][2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The impact score of 15/50 is considered low because, while the organization demonstrates capacity building through weekend schools and Quran distribution, there is a lack of third-party verification for its cost-effectiveness and long-term outcomes [1][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Islamic Society of Greater Houston serves as a central pillar for the Muslim community in Texas, providing essential religious, educational, and social welfare services.
strengths: Established provider of essential religious services including zakat distribution and funeral management
Strong community engagement with high weekend school enrollment and educational outreach
baseline_narrative.summary: The Islamic Society of Greater Houston (ISGH) is dedicated to helping the community live sustainable lives through comprehensive social programs and religious infrastructure [1][3]. As a zakat-eligible organization, it facilitates the distribution of community assistance and manages critical services including funeral arrangements and cemetery development [1][2].
